title: To me each song has a memory that goes with it. What are your most memorable memories that come to mind when you listen to a song? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can tell you one song that gives a rather strong flashback everytime. Peppermint Rainow: Pink Lemonade That song instantly reminds me of riding a chamois yellow cab that our family occasionally took in the early 80’s. Both the cab enterpreneur and his wife who drove the cab in turns, are long gone, I believe, they weren’t young even back then. Well. It is strange that this song gives me this cab flashback because I heard it in a situation not at all related to the cab, the rough era aside. I heard the song after my grandpa had recently passed and we were doing the estate inventory. There was not much really. His most valuable possessions, two well kept old East-German cars, went to remote non-descendant relatives who bought them from the estate dirt cheap. The piece of heirloom I got was a mono ree-to-reel tape recorder which I didn’t even know he’d had, and twenty-some tapes recorded mainly off the radio. We listened to those tapes through, and somehow a short excerpt of this song would haunt me for the two decades to come. I knew no English language then, but somehow, years later I mulled it over in my mind… when I’m with you, one glass will do, of pink lemonade …yes that must be what it said. But it was no use googling the lyrics. As a stroke of luck I found a cassette tape in 2005 or so, that was recorded from the old tape. That had been in my mom’s possession all the time, buried in a buro drawer and almost forgotten. I recorded the excerpt on the computer, and emailed it to many people who I knew to be familiar with late 60’s music. Kinda had to be that era, because granny said that the device had been acquired mid-60’s and had been sitting abandoned in a closet for many years before I was born. Also played the file to many friends. Finally, one of my friends found a fresh republication of an old album carrying a name resembling the lyrics, only available on CD… lo and behold! That was it. Nice hippie era album, which I went to order from a record store in the city where I worked. Also it is quite odd that for many years in the early 90’s I enthusiastically listened to and recorded a weekly radio show that played 60’s music, but never, ever did they cover the song or even the band. Must have been quite obscure stuff at its time.

I have one very clear memory of a song. In about 1977 I was driving thro the NZ countryside in my 1976 911 with the top off. My girlfriend by my side and on the amazing Blaupunkt stereo was Gordon Lightfoot singing the “The Last Time”. When the violin interlude came on I was overcome with emotion. A moment of pure bliss. That happened over 40 years ago and I remember it like yesterday. One of my favourite memories.
